RelatedSentence: Shame on the Globe for telling Harvard that it should and can censor unpopular or offensive speech because it is a private university ( ' Black mass ' : Do n't feed the trolls , Editorial , May 14 ) .
Although the First Amendment does not apply directly to private colleges , good schools understand that freedom of expression is critical to all campuses , not just those that are government - run .
Thus , accrediting bodies consider respect for academic freedom in deciding to accredit a college .
Harvard President Drew Faust was right to refuse to censor those who had planned to put on a black mass .
Harvard President Drew Faust was right to refuse to censor those who had planned to put on a black mass .
Harvard President Drew Faust was right to refuse to censor those who had planned to put on a black mass .

RelatedSentence: Instead , she spoke about why the planned event was offensive .
Students can learn from her speech , while censorship rarely teaches positive lessons .
